abilities.description: User places hand on ground to dry out a huge area, turning it into desert wasteland and causing it to crumble.
An extremely powerful version of Ground Secco that dries up the ground and transforms everything with sustained ground contact—including people and buildings—into sand.
User's right hand can instantly desiccate anything it touches, draining moisture from living beings and objects.

weaknesses.description: When the user's sand body comes into contact with liquids such as water or blood, the sand solidifies and prevents dispersal, temporarily removing intangibility and making the user vulnerable to physical attacks.

historicalSignificance: One of the most powerful Logia-type Devil Fruits, allowing the user to create, control, and transform into sand. Used by Crocodile in his plot to take over Arabasta Kingdom.
trivia: Crocodile's sand abilities were countered by Luffy using water in their second and third battles.
The fruit's weakness to water is particularly ironic given Crocodile's ambition to control a desert kingdom.

abilities.description: User sprouts thirty arms from surfaces or bodies to restrain or manipulate targets.
User sprouts hands to choke or restrain opponents by wrapping around their necks or bodies.

weaknesses.description: Any damage dealt to the sprouted body parts is also felt by the user.

historicalSignificance: Allows the user to sprout replicas of their body parts on any surface. Used by Nico Robin for both combat and archaeological research.
trivia: Robin can sprout body parts on any surface within her range of vision.
The number in technique names (like 'Treinta' meaning thirty) indicates how many body parts are sprouted.

abilities.description: A water-enhanced version of Gomu Gomu no Pistol used while in Water Luffy form, allowing Luffy to hit Crocodile's sand body effectively.

weaknesses.description: Cannot swim and becomes weakened when submerged in water.
While immune to blunt attacks, the user can still be cut or pierced.

historicalSignificance: Grants the user a rubber body, making them immune to blunt attacks and able to stretch their limbs.
trivia: In episode 122, Luffy creatively combines his rubber abilities with water to counter Crocodile's sand powers.
This episode shows Luffy's growing tactical awareness in adapting his abilities to specific opponents.
